name: Pork Chops with Soy-Honey Glaze and Grilled Sweet Onions
description: Bobby Flay knows that pork takes well to a little sweetness, and this recipe for grilled pork chops with soy-honey glaze and grilled sweet onions illustrates that point perfectly . The saltiness of the soy sauce is balanced perfectly by...
recipeIngredient: pinch of hot red pepper flakes
8 (4- to 6-ounce) center-cut boneless pork chops, cut 1/2 inch thick
2 large Vidalia onions, sliced 1/2 inch thick

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the honey, soy and pepper flakes in a small bowl and season to taste with pepper.
Brush the chops on both sides with oil and season with salt and pepper. Set aside a few tablespoons of glaze for brushing the cooked chops.
Grill the pork chops until lightly crusty, 4 to 5 minutes.
Turn the chops over, reduce the heat to medium or move to a cooler part of the grill, and grill, brushing often with glaze, until just cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes.
Remove the chops to a platter and brush with the reserved glaze.
Brush the onion slices with oil and season with salt and pepper.
Grill the slices until browned, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Serve the chops with the onions on the side.
